classes should be separated by file. Put classes in different files. And that’s just an example to make you understand object oriented programming.
[/quote]
ever heard of inner classes?[/quote]

I tend not to use it because it’s ugly

item.title: Stupid java "assignment"
item.dc:creator: @cant_touch_this93 cant touch this93
item.description:
@cant_touch_this93 wrote:

One of the tutorials ive been reading had little “assignments” at the end. Basicly in this one, your an author writing a wester story. They give you something like this

“drinkWhiskey
drunkenness increases by one”

and you would give them this.

public void drinkWhiskey() { drunkenness ++; }

and it goes on with more “advanced things”(well advanced for me but for most its basic.) anyway here it is.

[code]public class WesternTown
{

int stabels;
int saloons;
int sheriffs;
int troublemakers;
String location;
int time;

public WesternTown()
}
stabels = 3
location = “Western America”;
time = “1850”;

}

}
public class Gunfight {
public static void main(String arguments[]) {
WesternTown sweatyPost = new WesternTown();
sweatyPost.saloons = 2;
sweatyPost.sheriffs = 1;
sweatyPost.troublemakers = 5;

Villains joe = new Villains();
joe.hatColor = “black”;
joe.mustacheColor = “red”;
joe.sex = “Male”;
joe.horseName = “Bob”;
joe.whiskeyPreference = “Jack Daniels”;

Humans mary = new Humans();
mary.sex = “female”;
mary.horseName = “Mary jr”;
mary.whiskeyPreference = “Straight”;
mary.name = “Mary”;

joe.drinkWhiskey();
System.out.println(joe.howDrunkAmI());
maurice.tieUpHostage(mary);
}

}
public class Humans{
int legs;
int arms;
int eyes;
int nose;
int mouth;
string name;
string sex;
string horseName;
string whiskeyPreference;

public Humans() {
	legs = 2;
	arms = 2;
	eyes = 2;
	nose = 1;
	mouth = 1;
}
public String whatIsYourName() {
	return name;

}
}
public class Villain extends Humans {
String mustachColour;
String hatColour;
String look;
int drunkenness;
int numberOfHostages;
Humans hostages;

		public Villian() {
			look = "mean"
			drunkedness = 0;
			numberOfHostages = 0;
			}

}
public Void drinkWhiskey() {
drunkenness ++;
}
public int howDrunkAmI() {
return drunkenness;
}
public Void tieUpHostage(Humans hostage) {
this.hostage = hostage;
numberOfHostages++;
System.out.println("The villian has tied up " + hostage.whatIsYourName());
}

}
[/code]
